sub_title: Program Manager, PMP, Prince2, SAFe Scrum Master & Agilist in Customer Experience @ Cisco; field hockey coach
summary:
I am an internationally experienced PMP, SAFe Scrum Master, SAFe Agilist, and Prince2 Practitioner certified program/project manager with extensive background in IT, instructional design & technology, and HR (employee learning & development, divestitures, restructurings, organizational change, compensation, system/tool development & implementation). Throughout my career, I have made a difference to thousands of people as well as many organisations across all continents. I have helped them become more cost-effective, impactful and successful in reaching their personal and organisational goals.

Interesting fact: early on in my career (see my job experience below) I successfully completed a training program in air traffic control. 

Getting problems solved and work accomplished as effectively as possible in close collaboration with other people from various professional and cultural backgrounds energises me. To me, there is nothing like a true team effort. Work is done on teams and cannot be successful without involving the right people with the right skills and the right team spirit.

The many different organisations that I have worked for, the people from various professional and cultural backgrounds that I have worked with, and the many types of jobs and projects that I have been responsible for have all helped me increase my cultural awareness, people knowledge, and expertise of a wide variety of professional areas.

I am practical, flexible, organised, reliable, persistent, accurate, tactful, respectful, professional, accommodating, probing, and client- and results-oriented. I also have a good sense of humour. Others conceive me as an advisor, teacher, organiser, creator, facilitator, collaborator, communicator, team player and listener.

I own MSc degrees in Technology Management and Software Engineering. 

When I am not at work, I love coaching one of the teams of the local field hockey club, as well as growing my professional skills by reading articles and books and attending courses.

school.name: The George Washington University School of Business

certifications.name: Royal Netherlands Field Hockey Association - Umpire

projects.title: Improve Cisco HR support intake model and experience
projects.description: Make Cisco global HR support intake model (tools, resources, processes) more proactive instead of reactive by understanding users' needs and pain points, anticipating support needs, and reducing the need to raise support cases.

People Consultant / Chief of Staff at Cisco
EMEA/APJC Leader for Global Performance Consulting and Leader Consulting Service

projects.title: Implementation of new Workday HRM system at Cisco Systems
projects.description: Benefits integrations track of implementation of new HRM system (Workday) at Cisco. I was responsible for Scrum Mastering (SAFe Agile) the build, testing and deployment of integrations between Workday and other systems within Cisco, as well as benefits vendor systems. Next to that I was responsible for managing the Workday environments (development, test etc. environments).

contributors.headline: Program Manager, PMP, Prince2, SAFe Scrum Master & Agilist in Customer Experience @ Cisco; field hockey coach
Product Owner - Workday Time & Absence at Cisco
IT Technical Program Manager at Cisco Systems

projects.title: Divestiture of Cisco's Service Provider Video Software Solutions
projects.description: Cisco's Service Provider Video Software Solutions business unit was sold to Synamedia and employees had to be transferred to the buying company in accordance with local regulations like TUPE in Europe. This divestiture happened in stages over several years. I was responsible for managing the divestiture activities in the EMEA region, which concerned over 1,000 employees.

contributors.headline: Program Manager, PMP, Prince2, SAFe Scrum Master & Agilist in Customer Experience @ Cisco; field hockey coach
Head of People and Culture EMEA, LATAM & APJ
Global Director, Employee and Labour Relations

projects.title: Cisco Sales New Year Readiness for fiscal year 2020
projects.description: I was responsible for project managing the Cisco Sales New Year Readiness project for fiscal year 2020 in the EMEA region. Sales New Year Readiness is a project that Cisco runs every fiscal year and is all about goal sheet creation for Cisco sellers. The project for fiscal year 2020 was incredibly complex because next to goal sheet creation the scope also included change of job titles and compensation plans, which needed to happen in accordance with local legal regulations. In this particular project the job titles and compensation plans of 1000s of EMEA sellers were changed, creating a giant legal puzzle.

contributors.headline: Program Manager, PMP, Prince2, SAFe Scrum Master & Agilist in Customer Experience @ Cisco; field hockey coach

projects.title: Teams Toolkit
projects.description: This project concerned the design, development, implementation, and continuous improvement of an online tool helping the Cisco HR organization become more effective at making Cisco teams successful. The tool included a database consisting of 100s of resources (articles, videos, presentations, quick reference guides, workshop materials etc.) related to improving team performance. Thanks to a set of easy to use filters the tool enabled quick searching & finding of resources. I was responsible for Scrum Mastering the project.

profile_positions.description: Develop the CX EMEA team so they can deliver market leading solutions; create leaders at all levels who empower, develop and engage our teams; build a culture that inspires our teams to do great things
profile_positions.title: Program Manager, SAFe Scrum Master & Agilist, EMEA Customer Experience

profile_positions.description: Leading projects to grow technical and business expertise of Cisco Customer Experience engineers, architects, and leaders, as well as projects to enhance delivery of Cisco services to Cisco customers
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager, SAFe Scrum Master & Agilist, EMEA Customer Experience Transformation Office

profile_positions.description: Responsible for managing global project to improve all of Cisco HR's support intake processes & experience.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager, SAFe Scrum Master & Agilist, HR Projects & Portfolio organization

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for leading benefits integrations track of implementation of new HRM system (Workday) at Cisco. Build, test and deploy hundreds of integrations between Workday and other systems within Cisco, as well as benefits vendor systems. All in accordance with SAFe Agile methodology.
- Also responsible for managing Cisco's Workday development, testing and production environments (aka tenants).
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager, SAFe Scrum Master & Agilist, HR Digital Experience organization

profile_positions.description:
- Set up and lead the Project Management Office for the Cisco EMEA HR organisation.
- Grow the program & project management expertise within Cisco EMEA HR and support & coach EMEA HR project managers.
- Manage multiple high-priority, high-impact pan-EMEA Cisco HR initiatives across about 50 countries and thousands of employees. Examples:
> Implementation and deployment of HR tools & systems
> Creation and roll-out of job rotation programs
> Introduction and adoption of team performance management tools and practices
> Divestiture, workforce reduction, and workforce outsourcing projects
profile_positions.title: EMEA HR Project Management Office Lead, SAFe Scrum Master & Agilist

profile_positions.description:
- Initiate, develop, implement and optimize cross-functional, in-country and cross-country learning & development strategies, events, programs, workshops and other activities for all Cisco EMEA employees, such as manager & leadership development programs and career & development events, face-to-face as well as virtual via web conferencing, video conferencing and Cisco TV broadcast.
- Provide consulting services in the above areas to Cisco internal teams around the globe.
- Create career & development event tools, templates, techniques and best practices for others within Cisco to use.
- Analyze & report L&D success metrics.
- Deliver workshops and other L&D events.
profile_positions.title: EMEA Project Manager, Talent Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Role similar to the one below.
- Main difference: propose, develop, execute and optimize learning & development strategies for 4 Cisco functions instead of 1, in EMEA region only, namely: EMEA IT, EMEA Supply Chain Operations, EMEA Marketing, and EMEA HR.
- Great opportunity to learn more about the Supply Chain, Marketing and HR organizations and functional areas and extend my network within Cisco EMEA.
profile_positions.title: EMEA Learning & Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Propose, develop, execute and optimize learning & development strategies and programs for the Cisco IT function globally to help improve the professional capabilities (soft skills, technical skills, leadership skills) of their workforce - individual contributors as well as people leaders.
- Worked closely together with IT senior leaders & executives (VP level and above) located around the globe (US, EMEA, APJC).
profile_positions.title: IT Learning & Development Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Manage global learning development projects for employees in IT and other Cisco functions (examples of topics: business processes, IT tools, health & safety regulations, anti-discriminatory law).
- Types of solutions developed: e-learning, classroom training, virtual classroom training using Web-conferencing tools.
- Project teams consisted of up to 10 people located across the globe (subject-matter experts, graphic artists, instructional designers/developers).
profile_positions.title: Project Manager IT Training

company.name: LOI - one of the largest distant educators in The Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
- Innovate the technologies used to create and deliver LOI's offerings.
- Manage and administer learning processes and data.
- Technologies introduced: virtual classrooms, simulations, interactive e-learning courses, online digital portfolio, enhancements to LOI's in-house learning management system.
- Provided consulting services in the area of instructional design of virtual classes, simulations, e-learning courses and face-to-face classes.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Project Manager/Consultant E-learning

profile_positions.description:
- Worked in Intellinex subsidiary, providing customized and corporate learning solutions to execute business strategies, as well as developing learning content and curriculums for corporate clients and government agencies in North America and Europe.
- Managed European Learning Development department, consisting of about 5 project managers, instructional designers and graphics artists.
 - Managed learning development projects (e-learning, instructor-led learning) on topics ranging from business processes and regulations to high-tech for international corporate clients.
- Clients were located in Netherlands, France, Germany, Norway, UK, USA, Belgium.
- Project teams consisted of 3-10 people (designers, developers, graphic artists, engineers, subject-matter experts).
- Created learning solutions in role of Senior Instructional Designer.
- Provided sales support.
- Delivered instructor-led training and consultancy services on instructional design and learning management and learning content management systems to clients.
profile_positions.title: Department & Project Manager/Senior Instructional Designer

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for managing a new innovative and advanced software system for automatic scheduling of passenger and cargo flights and cockpit and cabin crews in accordance with local and international regulations.
- Responsible for enhancing the functionalities of the system in collaboration with the system's vendor and other airline companies like Finnair.
- Developed and delivered e-learning, instructor-led training and user manuals for the crew and flight scheduling departments and crew members to support successful roll-out of the system.
profile_positions.title: System Manager/E-learning Developer/Trainer

profile_positions.description:
- Initiated, planned and managed research and development projects in the areas of pilot and air traffic controller training in collaboration with e.g. Dutch air traffic control authority (LVNL), Eurocontrol, NATO, other European aerospace research institutes. 
- Developed simulation systems to train pilots and air traffic controllers on using new, innovative technologies.
- Published research articles
- Presented at international aerospace training conferences.
- Completed air traffic controller training program for Amsterdam Airport Approach Area delivered by the Dutch air traffic control authorities.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager/Researcher/Training Specialist
